[confused] Wait, this can't be right. I'm looking at the voting record and... oh my God. The amendment I wrote—the one about environmental protections—he completely flipped it. [gasp softly] He used my data, my research, all those late nights I spent... but he twisted it to argue the opposite point. How does he even—I mean, I specifically showed how those regulations would prevent contamination, and he's using it to say they're unnecessary? [angry] That's my work. That's MY work he's standing up there quoting.

[pause]

And the education policy brief? Oh no. Ummm... he took the budget analysis and used it to justify cutting funding. [bitter] I wrote that to show why we need MORE resources, not less. This is... I feel sick. All those families I interviewed, the teachers who trusted me with their stories—I promised them this research would help. [shaky voice] And now it's being weaponized against everything I believe in.

[sigh]

I don't know, maybe I should have seen this coming? He kept asking for, um, "alternative interpretations" of the data. [frustrated] But I thought he just wanted to understand all angles, you know? Not... not this. God, I'm such an idiot. Two years. [furious] Two years of my life thinking I was making a difference, and instead I've been helping destroy everything I care about.

subject: Finding out your politician boss has been using your policy research to support causes you morally oppose
